poem:
"Ode to the Humble Fowl"

Hieroglyphics of sustenance, 
In five ways the chicken graced,
Moro's artisans, Sam and Sam,
In culinary tapestry they traced.
A feast for kin, or staff repast,
Purpose as eternally vast.
Pleasure dished from pan and pot,
Beneath the smiles, lays a thought,
Are we not all, at core,
Chasing joy, wanting more?
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Five ways with chicken – recipes from Moro’s Sam and Sam Clark These recipes, using a whole chicken or many of its parts, offer quick and nutritious ways to feed either the family with little time or, for us, cook staff lunch for the chefs and waiters at Moro. The reason we cook today is the same as it has always been, to give people pleasure and put a huge smile on their faces. We". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
